description: Retrieves information about an asset model composite model (also known as an asset model component). For more information, see Custom composite models (Components) in the IoT SiteWise User Guide.

parameters.name: assetModelId
parameters.description: The ID of the asset model. This can be either the actual ID in UUID format, or else externalId: followed by the external ID, if it has one. For more information, see Referencing objects with external IDs in the IoT SiteWise User Guide.

parameters.name: assetModelCompositeModelId
parameters.description: The ID of a composite model on this asset model. This can be either the actual ID in UUID format, or else externalId: followed by the external ID, if it has one. For more information, see Referencing objects with external IDs in the IoT SiteWise User Guide.

nested_items.name: assetModelId
nested_items.description: The ID of the asset model, in UUID format.

nested_items.name: assetModelCompositeModelId
nested_items.description: The ID of a composite model on this asset model.

nested_items.name: assetModelCompositeModelExternalId
nested_items.description: The external ID of a composite model on this asset model.

nested_items.name: assetModelCompositeModelPath
nested_items.description: The path to the composite model listing the parent composite models.

nested_items.name: id
nested_items.description: The ID of the path segment.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the path segment.

nested_items.name: assetModelCompositeModelName
nested_items.description: The unique, friendly name for the composite model.

nested_items.name: assetModelCompositeModelDescription
nested_items.description: The description for the composite model.

nested_items.name: assetModelCompositeModelType
nested_items.description: The composite model type. Valid values are AWS/ALARM, CUSTOM, or AWS/L4E_ANOMALY.

nested_items.name: assetModelCompositeModelProperties
nested_items.description: The property definitions of the composite model.

nested_items.name: id
nested_items.description: The ID of the asset model property.

If you are callling UpdateAssetModel to create a new property: You can specify its ID here, if desired. IoT SiteWise automatically generates a unique ID for you, so this parameter is never required. However, if you prefer to supply your own ID instead, you can specify it here in UUID format. If you specify your own ID, it must be globally unique.

If you are calling UpdateAssetModel to modify an existing property: This can be either the actual ID in UUID format, or else externalId: followed by the external ID, if it has one. For more information, see Referencing objects with external IDs in the IoT SiteWise User Guide.

nested_items.name: externalId
nested_items.description: The external ID (if any) provided in the CreateAssetModel or UpdateAssetModel operation. You can assign an external ID by specifying this value as part of a call to UpdateAssetModel. However, you can't change the external ID if one is already assigned. For more information, see Using external IDs in the IoT SiteWise User Guide.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the asset model property.

nested_items.name: dataType
nested_items.description: The data type of the asset model property.

nested_items.name: dataTypeSpec
nested_items.description: The data type of the structure for this property. This parameter exists on properties that have the STRUCT data type.

nested_items.name: unit
nested_items.description: The unit of the asset model property, such as Newtons or RPM.

nested_items.name: attribute
nested_items.description: Specifies an asset attribute property. An attribute generally contains static information, such as the serial number of an IIoT wind turbine.

nested_items.name: defaultValue
nested_items.description: The default value of the asset model property attribute. All assets that you create from the asset model contain this attribute value. You can update an attribute's value after you create an asset. For more information, see Updating attribute values in the IoT SiteWise User Guide.

nested_items.name: measurement
nested_items.description: Specifies an asset measurement property. A measurement represents a device's raw sensor data stream, such as timestamped temperature values or timestamped power values.

nested_items.name: processingConfig
nested_items.description: The processing configuration for the given measurement property. You can configure measurements to be kept at the edge or forwarded to the Amazon Web Services Cloud. By default, measurements are forwarded to the cloud.

nested_items.name: forwardingConfig
nested_items.description: The forwarding configuration for the given measurement property.

nested_items.name: state
nested_items.description: The forwarding state for the given property.

nested_items.name: transform
nested_items.description: Specifies an asset transform property. A transform contains a mathematical expression that maps a property's data points from one form to another, such as a unit conversion from Celsius to Fahrenheit.

nested_items.name: expression
nested_items.description: The mathematical expression that defines the transformation function. You can specify up to 10 variables per expression. You can specify up to 10 functions per expression.

nested_items.name: variables
nested_items.description: The list of variables used in the expression.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The friendly name of the variable to be used in the expression.

nested_items.name: propertyId
nested_items.description: The ID of the property to use as the variable. You can use the property name if it's from the same asset model. If the property has an external ID, you can specify externalId: followed by the external ID. For more information, see Using external IDs in the IoT SiteWise User Guide.

nested_items.name: hierarchyId
nested_items.description: The ID of the hierarchy to query for the property ID. You can use the hierarchy's name instead of the hierarchy's ID. If the hierarchy has an external ID, you can specify externalId: followed by the external ID. For more information, see Using external IDs in the IoT SiteWise User Guide.

nested_items.name: propertyPath
nested_items.description: The path of the property.

nested_items.name: id
nested_items.description: The ID of the path segment.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the path segment.

nested_items.name: processingConfig
nested_items.description: The processing configuration for the given transform property. You can configure transforms to be kept at the edge or forwarded to the Amazon Web Services Cloud. You can also configure transforms to be computed at the edge or in the cloud.

nested_items.name: computeLocation
nested_items.description: The compute location for the given transform property.

nested_items.name: forwardingConfig
nested_items.description: The forwarding configuration for a given property.

nested_items.name: state
nested_items.description: The forwarding state for the given property.

nested_items.name: expression
nested_items.description: The mathematical expression that defines the metric aggregation function. You can specify up to 10 variables per expression. You can specify up to 10 functions per expression.

nested_items.name: variables
nested_items.description: The list of variables used in the expression.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The friendly name of the variable to be used in the expression.

nested_items.name: propertyId
nested_items.description: The ID of the property to use as the variable. You can use the property name if it's from the same asset model. If the property has an external ID, you can specify externalId: followed by the external ID. For more information, see Using external IDs in the IoT SiteWise User Guide.

nested_items.name: hierarchyId
nested_items.description: The ID of the hierarchy to query for the property ID. You can use the hierarchy's name instead of the hierarchy's ID. If the hierarchy has an external ID, you can specify externalId: followed by the external ID. For more information, see Using external IDs in the IoT SiteWise User Guide.

nested_items.name: propertyPath
nested_items.description: The path of the property.

nested_items.name: id
nested_items.description: The ID of the path segment.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the path segment.

nested_items.name: interval
nested_items.description: The time interval for the tumbling window. The interval time must be between 1 minute and 1 week.

nested_items.name: offset
nested_items.description: The offset for the tumbling window. The offset parameter accepts the following:
The offset time. For example, if you specify 18h for offset and 1d for interval, IoT SiteWise aggregates data in one of the following ways:
If you create the metric before or at 6 PM (UTC), you get the first aggregation result at 6 PM (UTC) on the day when you create the metric.
If you create the metric after 6 PM (UTC), you get the first aggregation result at 6 PM (UTC) the next day.
The ISO 8601 format. For example, if you specify PT18H for offset and 1d for interval, IoT SiteWise aggregates data in one of the following ways:
If you create the metric before or at 6 PM (UTC), you get the first aggregation result at 6 PM (UTC) on the day when you create the metric.
If you create the metric after 6 PM (UTC), you get the first aggregation result at 6 PM (UTC) the next day.

The 24-hour clock. For example, if you specify 00:03:00 for offset, 5m for interval, and you create the metric at 2 PM (UTC), you get the first aggregation result at 2:03 PM (UTC). You get the second aggregation result at 2:08 PM (UTC).
The offset time zone. For example, if you specify 2021-07-23T18:00-08 for offset and 1d for interval, IoT SiteWise aggregates data in one of the following ways:
If you create the metric before or at 6 PM (PST), you get the first aggregation result at 6 PM (PST) on the day when you create the metric.
If you create the metric after 6 PM (PST), you get the first aggregation result at 6 PM (PST) the next day.

nested_items.name: processingConfig
nested_items.description: The processing configuration for the given metric property. You can configure metrics to be computed at the edge or in the Amazon Web Services Cloud. By default, metrics are forwarded to the cloud.

nested_items.name: computeLocation
nested_items.description: The compute location for the given metric property.

nested_items.name: path
nested_items.description: The structured path to the property from the root of the asset model.

nested_items.name: id
nested_items.description: The ID of the path segment.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the path segment.

nested_items.name: compositionDetails
nested_items.description: Metadata for the composition relationship established by using composedAssetModelId in CreateAssetModelCompositeModel. For instance, an array detailing the path of the composition relationship for this composite model.

nested_items.name: compositionRelationship
nested_items.description: An array detailing the composition relationship for this composite model.

nested_items.name: id
nested_items.description: The ID of the component.

nested_items.name: assetModelCompositeModelSummaries
nested_items.description: The list of composite model summaries for the composite model.

nested_items.name: id
nested_items.description: The ID of the composite model that this summary describes..

nested_items.name: externalId
nested_items.description: The external ID of a composite model on this asset model. For more information, see Using external IDs in the IoT SiteWise User Guide.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the composite model that this summary describes..

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The composite model type. Valid values are AWS/ALARM, CUSTOM, or AWS/L4E_ANOMALY.

nested_items.name: description
nested_items.description: The description of the composite model that this summary describes..

nested_items.name: path
nested_items.description: The path that includes all the pieces that make up the composite model.

nested_items.name: id
nested_items.description: The ID of the path segment.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the path segment.

nested_items.name: actionDefinitions
nested_items.description: The available actions for a composite model on this asset model.

nested_items.name: actionDefinitionId
nested_items.description: The ID of the action definition.

nested_items.name: actionName
nested_items.description: The name of the action definition.

nested_items.name: actionType
nested_items.description: The type of the action definition.
